translated: The Shorter Expositions🔽The verses of the Pārāyanavagga
The verses of the Pārāyananugīti
I will chant the Pārāyana,
(so said the venerable Piṅgiya)
As I have seen, so I will speak;
Stainless, of great wisdom,
Free from desire, emancipated, a nāga;

analyzed: kissa hetu musā bhaṇe  pahīna mala mohassa
translated: For what reason would he speak falsely?🔽For one who has abandoned impurity and delusion,
Who has abandoned conceit and hypocrisy;
Now I will praise
Words that are well-formed.
The Buddha, the dispeller of darkness, the all-seeing one,
Who has gone to the end of the world, overcome all existence;
Free from taints, having abandoned all suffering,
The one who speaks the truth, the brahmin, is worshipped by me.
Just as a bird would abandon a small pond
And dwell in a forest with abundant fruit;
So I, having abandoned the small,
Have entered the great ocean, like a swan.
Those who in the past have declared
That the teaching of the Gotama is false;

analyzed: id ca asi iti bhavissati  sabbam tam iti hi iti ha
translated: It is so, it will be so,🔽All that is thus it was, thus it is;
All that is an increase in speculation.
Alone, the dispeller of darkness,
The radiant one, the illuminator;
Gotama, of great wisdom,
Gotama, the one of great wisdom.

analyzed: yaḥ me dhammam adesesi  sandiṭṭhikam akālika
translated: He who taught me the Dhamma,🔽Immediately visible, not delayed,

Even for a moment, Piṅgiya?🔽Gotama, the one of great wisdom,
Gotama, the one of great understanding.
